itemListElement.name: Oatmeal Cranberry Cookies! Part Deux! Vegan

@graph.name: Oatmeal Cranberry Cookies. Part Deux. Vegan.
@graph.description: Oatmeal Cranberry Cookies. Made with nut butters and packed full of goodness. These healthy cookies make a great snack or treat any time of the day! Vegan Recipe.
recipeIngredient: 2 tablespoons Raw turbinado sugar or jaggery
1.5 tablespoon roasted almond butter ((Homemade nut butter recipes))
1 tablespoon Organic Canola Oil or coconut oil ((coconut oil will add a slight coconutty taste))
1/2 cup self rising flour ((can be substituted by all purpose flour + 1/4 teaspoon baking powder))

recipeInstructions.text: In a bowl, mix the flax meal and hot water and let sit for a minute.
recipeInstructions.name: In a bowl, mix the flax meal and hot water and let sit for a minute.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the room temperature almond butter, oil, sugar and agave syrup and mix well by hand or by hand mixer until the mixture feels light. The almond I used was store bought and it takes a while to mix up.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the room temperature almond butter, oil, sugar and agave syrup and mix well by hand or by hand mixer until the mixture feels light. The almond I used was store bought and it takes a while to mix up.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in 1/2 cup oats, salt, cinnamon powder and lemon juice and a little flour(1/4 cup) and mix till just about combined.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in 1/2 cup oats, salt, cinnamon powder and lemon juice and a little flour(1/4 cup) and mix till just about combined.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in more oats and flour if needed to get gooey muffin mixture kind of consistency, Or a very sticky dough. If you added too much flour or oatmeal and the mixture looks like a stiff dry dough, then add in a little oil and or lemon juice to make it gooey. (If the dough is stiff and not sticky, the cookies might come out too hard)
recipeInstructions.name: Add in more oats and flour if needed to get gooey muffin mixture kind of consistency, Or a very sticky dough. If you added too much flour or oatmeal and the mixture looks like a stiff dry dough, then add in a little oil and or lemon juice to make it gooey. (If the dough is stiff and not sticky, the cookies might come out too hard)

recipeInstructions.text: Oil hands or tablespoon and pick up tablespoon full dough, drop them and flatten on parchment paper. Thinner the better.!
recipeInstructions.name: Oil hands or tablespoon and pick up tablespoon full dough, drop them and flatten on parchment paper. Thinner the better.!

recipeInstructions.text: Bake in preheated oven at 350 degrees F for 10-11 minutes(add minutes depending on the thickness of the cookie). The cookies should Not be runny or liquidy.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake in preheated oven at 350 degrees F for 10-11 minutes(add minutes depending on the thickness of the cookie). The cookies should Not be runny or liquidy.

recipeInstructions.text: They might look wet because of the shiny oil, but check with toothpick to confirm they are not squishy. They cook quite easily esp because there is no egg!
recipeInstructions.name: They might look wet because of the shiny oil, but check with toothpick to confirm they are not squishy. They cook quite easily esp because there is no egg!

recipeInstructions.text: Take cookies off baking tray and cool on rack for a few minutes!
recipeInstructions.name: Take cookies off baking tray and cool on rack for a few minutes!

recipeInstructions.text: Store in airtight container for a week or so. Let me know how yours turn out!
recipeInstructions.name: Store in airtight container for a week or so. Let me know how yours turn out!
